intro: Argyrolobium, commonly known as the silver globular vetch, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. These plants are native to southern Africa and are characterized by their distinctive silver-green foliage and globular seed pods. The species are typically shrubs or subshrubs with small, clustered leaves and produce yellow or white flowers. Argyrolobium species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making them resilient to drought conditions. They play an important role in soil stabilization and are sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
